page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT IN HOUSTON
page.content: Since Houston functions as a{dormitory village it provides few employment opportunities. The majority of residents{commute}to towns and cities like Paisley and Glasgow. An important source of employment in the area is farming,although this is often seasonal work during harvesting e.g.{rhubarb picking in July.}Most farms are worked by the farmer and his family. The old Houston mill is now a babywear manufacturer. A major workplace is Gryffe High School lying on the western edge, which serves Houston and Bridge of Weir and employs about 100 staff with around 50 at the two primary schools. Service industries e.g. clinic,shops employ some people. School leavers seek higher education and work in Paisley and Glasgow.
